src:
Olahan Bebek Maknyus
Menikmati Asam Pedas Geseng Bangsong di Pasar Wit-witan Banyuwangi
04 Nov 2019, 04:00 by Ardian Fanani - detikFood


Foto: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

Banyuwangi - Satu lagi kuliner tradisional Banyuwangi yang bisa dinikmati masyarakat luas. Geseng bongsong bangsong khas desa Singolatren yang gurih pedas. Bikin nagih!Destinasi wisata kuliner di Banyuwangi yang saat ini sedang menjadi primadona adalah Pasar Wit-witan yang terletak di Desa Alasmalang, Kecamatan Singojuruh, SingolatrenBanyuwangi. Berada di bawah pepohonan yang rindang, wisatawan bisa menikmati berbagai kuliner tradisional, termasuk geseng bangsong yang khas Singojuruh.Pasar kuliner tradisional ini buka setiap hari Minggu pagi, mulai pukul 06.00 - 10.00. Bupati Banyuwangi Abdullah Azwar Anas pun berkesempatan mengunjunginya beberapa saat lalu. Bupati Anas mengaku sangat menikmati kekhasan saat makan di pasar tersebut, terutama Geseng Bangsong (itik jantan).


Foto: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

"Nikmat sekali rasanya. Rasa pedas bercampur asam dari daun wadung yang menjadi campuran bumbunya sungguh nikmat," ujar Anas kepada detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).Geseng Bangsong adalah makanan khas Dusun Wijenan Kidul, Desa Singolatren, Singojuruh. Makanan ini biasanya dihidangkan saat acara-acara keagamaan umat Islam. Seperti Maulid Nabi, Hari Raya Idul Fitri, dan Idul Adha.Bahan bakunya adalah daging itik berukuran besar. Dan itik tersebut harus jantan, karena ukurannya yang besar.


Foto: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

Baca Juga : Di Sini Ada Bebek Bali, Bebek Goreng Renyah hingga Bebek Pecatu Selain geseng bangsong, di pasar tersebut juga dijajakan Rawon Alas, Sego Cawuk, hingga aneka kudapan tradisional seperti tiwul, gatot. Untuk minuman, mulai dari jamu hingga es cendol juga ditemukan di sini. Juga aneka jajanan tradisional seperti tiwul, getuk, gatot dan lain-lain.Tak hanya itu, para pedagang makanan juga diwajibkan mengenakan busana adat khas masyarakat Using Banyuwangi. Di pasar ini juga tak boleh ada wadah dan sampah plastik. Para penjual makanan menggunakan daun pisang hingga tempurung kelapa untuk makan dan minum."Ini memang ketentuan yang sudah disepakati oleh panitia, yaitu ibu-ibu PKK Desa Alasmalang. Bahkan mereka sangat ketat, agar penjual tidak menggunakan tempat atau wadah dari plastik. Makanya bisa dilihat sendiri, untuk minuman menggunakan tempurung kelapa atau potongan bambu sebagai mangkok dan gelas. Juga Cobek dari tanah, dengan alas daun", ujar Mochamad Lutfi, Camat Singojuruh Banyuwangi, Jumat (1/11/2019).


Foto: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

Menikmati aneka kuliner di masa lampau di tempat ini memang beda suasananya. Karena berada di kawasan hutan kecil yang penuh dengan pepohonan. Tempat duduk juga dari bangku bambu, sendok yang digunakan juga dari kayu."Alhamdulillah mendapat sambutan positif, karena pengunjung tambah banyak dan mereka yang ingin bergabung pun juga tambah banyak. Namun demikian, panitia tetap menyeleksi dengan ketat mulai dari olahan yang ditawarkan, hingga kemasan dan penampilan penjualannya," tambah Lutfi.Pasar yang ramai dikunjungi ratusan wisatawan ini memberi berkah bagi para pedagangnya yang semuanya adalah warga setempat. Seperti yang dikatakan Lamhatin, pedagang Geseng Entok. Wanita yang memiliki usaha warung Geseng 'Mbak Tin' ini mengaku bisa meraup keuntungan lebih tinggi saat berjualan di Pasar Wit-Witan.


Foto: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

"Kalau jualan di rumah, saya biasanya habis 6-7 ekor entok per hari. Namun di Pasar Wit-Witan ini, saya bisa masak hingga 24 ekor entok. Itupun dua jam saja sudah ludes. Alhamdulillah," kata Tin, sapaan akrabnya.Hal serupa juga diungkapkan Sundari, pembuat aneka dodol. "Setiap minggu berjualan di Wit-witan, omsetnya mencapai Rp. 5-6 juta. Angka ini setara dengan yang saya dapatkan kalau berjualan dodol dari rumah selama satu minggu. Jadi ini sangat bermanfaat bagi keluarga kami," ujar Sundari.Bupati Anas sangat mengapresiasi langkah masyarakat desa yang mendukung pariwisata daerah sekaligus menggerakkan perekonomian warga setempat."Sepertinya memang sederhana, tapi ini bisa menjadi kekuatan ekonomi baru bagi masyarakat sekitar. Kami pun terus mendorong agar ke depan setiap kecamatan bisa memiliki satu pasar tradisional yang menjual kuliner khas dan menampilkan kesenian daerah setempat," kata Anas.Baca Juga : Harum Krenyes Bebek Goreng Chichi Bertabur Remahan Rempah Simak Video "Sensasi Rasa Dawet Hitam, Lebih Kenyal dan Gurih"[Gambas:Video 20detik](raf/odi)
text:
Processed Duck Maknyus
Enjoying the Spicy Acid Geseng Bangsong at the Banyuwangi Wit-witan Market
Nov 04 2019, 04:00 by Ardian Fanani - detikFood


Photo: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

Banyuwangi - Another traditional Banyuwangi culinary that can be enjoyed by the wider community. Geseng bongsong bangsong typical of savory and spicy Singolatren village. The culinary tourism destination in Banyuwangi which is currently being excellent is the Wit-witan Market located in Alasmalang Village, Singojuruh District, Singolatren Banyuwangi. Under the shady trees, tourists can enjoy a variety of traditional culinary, including the Jengkong bangsong which is typical of Singojuruh. This traditional culinary market is open every Sunday morning, starting at 6:00 to 10:00. Banyuwangi Regent Abdullah Azwar Anas also had the opportunity to visit him a while ago. Anas Regent claimed to really enjoy the uniqueness when eating at the market, especially Geseng Bangsong (male duck).


Photo: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

"It's delicious. The spicy taste mixed with acid from wadung leaves which becomes a spice mixture is really delicious," Anas told AFP on Friday (1/11/2019). Bangsong Village is a special food of Wijenan Kidul Hamlet, Singolatren Village, Singojuruh. This food is usually served at Muslim religious events. Such as the Prophet's Birthday, Eid al-Fitr, and Eid al-Adha. The raw material is large duck meat. And the duck must be male, because of its large size.


Photo: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

Also Read: Here There are Bali Duck, Crispy Fried Duck to Pecatu Duck In addition to the jelong bangsong, the market also sells Rawon Alas, Sego Cawuk, to various traditional snacks such as tiwul, gatot. For drinks, from herbs to cendol ice, are also found here. Also a variety of traditional snacks such as tiwul, getuk, gatot and others. Not only that, food traders are also required to wear traditional clothing typical of Using Banyuwangi people. In this market there are also no plastic containers and trash. Food sellers use banana leaves to coconut shells to eat and drink. "This is indeed a provision agreed upon by the committee, namely PKK Alasmalang Village women. In fact they are very strict, so that sellers do not use plastic containers or containers. itself, for drinks using coconut shells or bamboo pieces as bowls and cups. Also Cobek from the ground, with a leaf base ", said Mochamad Lutfi, Head of Singojuruh Banyuwangi District, Friday (11/01/2019).


Photo: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

Enjoy a variety of culinary in the past in this place is different atmosphere. Because it is in a small forest area full of trees. Seats are also made of bamboo benches, spoons used are also made of wood. "Alhamdulillah received positive response, because there were more visitors and those who wanted to join were also many. However, the committee continued to select closely from the preparations offered, to the packaging. and the appearance of the sale, "Lutfi added. The market, which was visited by hundreds of tourists, gave blessings to the traders, all of whom were local residents. As Lamhatin said, the merchant Geseng Entok. The woman who owns the Geseng 'Mbak Tin' stall business claims she can reap higher profits when selling at the Wit-Witan Market.


Photo: Ardian Fanani / dok.detikFood

"When selling at home, I usually run out of 6-7 ducks per day. But in this Wit-Witan Market, I can cook up to 24 ducks. Even then, it's only two hours out. Alhamdulillah," said Tin, his familiar greeting. a similar statement was also expressed by Sundari, a maker of various dodols. "Every week I sell at Wit-witan, the turnover reaches Rp. 5-6 million. This figure is equivalent to what I get when selling dodol from home for one week. So this is very beneficial for our family," Sundari said. Regent Anas was very appreciative the steps of the village community to support regional tourism while at the same time drive the economy of the local people. "It seems simple, but this can be a new economic force for the surrounding community. We also continue to push forward that each sub-district can have a traditional market that sells culinary specialties and displays the arts local area, "said Anas.
